Hm. You have a local nautilus-folder-handler.desktop. What does it Exec?   grep Exec ~/.local/share/applications/nautilus-folder-handler.desktop
Ok, any of the other desktop files running gedit? My best guess is that one of the other entries for directories is causing the issue.   grep 'Exec=.*gedit' ~/.local/share/applications/*.desktop
And I've never seen  text/directory  mime before. Not sure if that could have anything to do with it or not.
The only entry where gedit is mentioned is in "gedit.desktop"
Odd that you have a local copy of gedit.desktop at all in there though.
So you think I could delete that file?
If you delete it, it will use gedit.desktop from /usr/share/applications/ instead, so yes, it's safe to delete it from your homedir.
Okay. Do I need to restart Nautilus (or Gnome) to make it notice the change?
No, it should pick it up automagically
okay, thanks. Not that it changed anything though.

Well, I'm pretty sure it's something in ~/.local/share/applications causing this. If you move it away, things should work, but that removes all other customizations you've done too.  mv ~/.local/share/applications{,.backup}
All other customizations regarding which applications open what type of files, that is.
Could be worse. Probably worth giving it a try.
Oh, and all the wine-launchers too. They all start with wine-* though, so you can copy them back after you've tried.
wow! That actually did it, thanks! Now I only have to find out what association caused the problem.
